name: Instant Pot® Roasted Whole Chicken
author: RainbowJewels
summary: Roast a whole chicken in a hurry for a speedy dinner with an Instant Pot® when you're short on time.
ingredients: 1 (5 pound) roasting chicken, rinsed, giblets removed
1 pinch dried rosemary, or to taste
1 pinch dried parsley, or to taste
directions: Rub chicken on all sides with salt, pepper, garlic powder, rosemary, and parsley
Turn on a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot®) and select Saute function
Heat olive oil and add chicken, breast-side down
Cook until skin is browned, about 5 minutes
Use tongs to flip chicken and brown on the other side for another 5 minutes
Carefully remove chicken from the pot and set aside
Pour in chicken stock and deglaze the pan, scraping off all the browned bits
Place the rack insert into the pot and return chicken to the pot, breast-side up
Select Poultry setting  and set timer for 28 minutes
Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build
Release pressure using the natural-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, 10 to 40 minutes
Carefully remove chicken to a carving board to rest
Turn on Saute function and whisk cornstarch into the pot with the stock and drippings to make a gravy
